CatDescriptText: Mrs. Rose McCoy, 84 Fountain Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "I think so. Just recently I read an article about juvenile delinquency which compared that in Europe, especially Italy, with the situation here.  The article pointed out that while the father is the head of the house, there is less juvenile delinquency.  That was in Italy.  Here, the kids run their parents."
TitMainTitle: Man writing on notepad, facing Rose McCoy wearing light colored coat with brooch on lapel and light colored patterned scarf, standing across from Helfer's Jewelers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
